lines.text:
[Discovering that he has mistaken a phony diamond for a real one]
That settles it! I'm gonna change my wife's stone for a washing machine!
Wait a minute, Falcon. You can't let me down! You're the only guy who knows the diamond racket inside out.
Get thee behind me, O'Hara.
I told you I don't know anything, and I don't want to find out anything!
What's the matter, Bates? Can't you take 'em?

[Trying to act macho]
Are you gonna come quietly, Falcon?

[Putting his finger by his lips and mouthing a 'shhh']
Yeah, I won't even wake you up.
Something tells me I'm going to be a widow before I'm a bride.

[to Rita knowingly]
I think you can be relied upon to close our deal with 'The Falcon.'
I think so. Then we meet at your apartment.
That's right. Come on, Dutch.

[to Dutch]
Oh, your hat.
[Handing him his hat]
Awfully sorry we won't meet again.

[Drolly]
Oh, that's one nice thing about my murder.
You're going to fix a window?

[Ominously]
No, I'm gonna fix your wagon.

[Understating]
Only a little murder wrap is all.
Murder?
Yes.
What makes you think you're a detective? Just because your arches are broken down?
I tell yuh, I'm as sober as a judge.
I'll put you before one, and we'll find out.

[to Helen, sarcastically about Gay]
I'm beginning to think that the worst thing I could do to that guy is let you catch up with him.

[When he realizes that the crooks intend to throw him down a trap door into the river]
You know, they say the best people are using concrete these days.
So long, Jack. You're on your own. What a break for crime!

[Seeing Gay and Helen embracing]
Awww, touching, ain't it?

[Referring to a bet he's lost to Helen]
Yeah, touches me for a buck.

[Leaving with O'Hara]
Oh, good-bye, darling.

[Taking the dollar from Goldie]
Yes, it'll be a down payment on my straight jacket.
